text: Get into the habit of asking "What should I hide?" You'll be surprised at how many difficult design issues dissolve before your eyes. Identify Areas Likely to Change A study of great designers found that one attribute they had in common was their ability to anticipate change (Glass 1995). Accommodating changes is one of the most challenging aspects of good program design. The goal is to isolate unstable areas so that the effect of a change will be limited to one routine, class, or package. Here are the steps you should follow in preparing for such perturbations.
